intro: Ellipeia leptopoda, commonly known as the slender-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in a basal rosette. Ellipeia leptopoda typically thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
